Use your own Typst functions

Source: vignettes/use-your-own-typst-functions.qmd

In r2typ, functions are all the same and defined using the typst_function() function. This means you can define your own Typst functions by using it as such:

library(r2typ)

my_cool_function <- function(...) typst_function("my_cool_function", ...)

my_cool_function(fill = red, size = pt(15), "hello world!")
#> [1] "#my_cool_function(fill: red, size: 15pt)[hello world!]"

To use it in a set rule, you just need to use the typst_set() function:

set_my_cool_function <- function(...) typst_set("my_cool_function", ...)

set_my_cool_function(fill = red, size = pt(15))
#> [1] "#set my_cool_function(fill: red, size: 15pt)"

Warning

The code above does not define a my_cool_function(). It just lets you use a pre-defined Typst function in R. This means that you have to define its behavior first!

Developed by Joseph Barbier.
